dataMapping.title: Event-Driven Budget Reallocation
dataMapping.subtitle: Recommended budget shifts and resource allocation based on current events impact
dataMapping.totalBudget: Total available budget for reallocation (e.g., '$500,000', '$2.5M quarterly budget')

allocations.primaryLabel: Budget category/content type (e.g., 'News-Adjacent Content', 'Crisis Communication', 'Comfort Entertainment', 'Local Market Support')
allocations.secondaryLabel: Allocation category description (e.g., 'Breaking news and current events coverage', 'Emergency audience communication', 'Stress-relief entertainment content')
allocations.description: Detailed rationale for budget allocation during event (e.g., 'Increased allocation for real-time news content due to 65% spike in news consumption', 'Emergency budget for crisis communication across all channels')
insights: Allocation insights (e.g., 'High engagement during event periods', 'Critical for audience retention', 'Opportunity for new audience acquisition')
risks: Allocation risks (e.g., 'May not sustain post-event', 'High competition for news content', 'Budget may be insufficient for full impact')
recommendations: Strategic recommendations (e.g., 'Increase allocation during major news cycles', 'Maintain flexible budget for rapid response', 'Monitor performance daily for adjustments')

metadata.impactedAudience: Audience size affected (e.g., '2.3M users', '45% of total audience')
metadata.dependencies: Budget dependencies (e.g., 'Requires content team expansion', 'Needs emergency approval')

summary.percentageOfBudget: Percentage of total budget being reallocated (e.g., '40%')
summary.expectedImpact: Overall expected impact of reallocation (e.g., 'Maintain 85% audience engagement during crisis')
summary.riskLevel: Overall risk level of reallocation strategy: 'low', 'medium', 'high'

requiredApprovals: Required approvals (e.g., 'Crisis Response Team', 'CFO approval for emergency funds', 'Content Strategy Lead')
